data.text: @jburnmurdoch My entire family is in Poland and yes, ppl ARE buying iodine tablets. I was given them when i was a child and chernobyl went off. This is sadly not our first rodeo.
@jburnmurdoch @badwebsites I have frequent video calls with my friends across Italy and, while worried for Ukraine, they are not preparing for war on their doorsteps.
@jburnmurdoch I am sure this is all even more the case in Poland, Finland, ...

@jburnmurdoch 1. It's <10h drive from Lviv to Berlin.
2. Everyone over 40 in Germany grew up either under a repressive regime backed by the USSR, or at the front of a West-East confrontation, "knowing" that the Russian invasion would come via the Northern German plain.

@jburnmurdoch Obviously this is hyperbole. But IMO many in the UK underestimate how much countries in central Europe *feel* threatened.
E.g. most seemed surprised by Germany's higher defense spending and military support for Ukraine; I (German, living in UK for 10 years) wasn't. Consider:
@jburnmurdoch @M_B_Petersen agreed, from this middle-aged mom in Berlin..

@ctaylor1902 @jburnmurdoch @twlldun Geography was never their strongest suit. They can barely name, or identify their own country. They're equally as terrible with their neighbours to the north, #Canada 🤦‍♀️
@jburnmurdoch Total nonsense, I’m based in Vienna and that’s SO NOT HAPPENING
